meanings.definition: To attack or destroy with a torpedo.
meanings.sent1: The navy ship was torpedoing the enemy vessel.
meanings.sent2: The submarine was torpedoing the target with precision.
meanings.sent3: The pirates were torpedoing the treasure chest to get to the gold inside.
meanings.sent4: The fierce storm was torpedoing the fragile sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The demolition team was torpedoing the old building to make space for a new one.

meanings.definition: To cause the failure or ruin of something.
meanings.sent1: The careless mistake ended up torpedoing the entire project.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected delay torpedoed our plans for the weekend getaway.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel torpedoed the picnic by stealing all the food.
meanings.sent4: The virus torpedoed the computer system, causing chaos in the office.
meanings.sent5: The leaked information torpedoed the company's reputation overnight.

meanings.definition: The act of launching or firing a torpedo.
meanings.sent1: The captain ordered the torpedoing of the enemy ship.
meanings.sent2: The successful torpedoing of the submarine was a strategic move.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy sailor accidentally triggered the torpedoing during training.
meanings.sent4: The historic photo captured the moment of torpedoing in battle.
meanings.sent5: The sound of torpedoing echoed through the silent night at sea.
